Experiment_description: The experiments involve treating SPR sequences as graphs processed through a two-layer Graph Convolutional Network with global-mean pooling and a linear classifier. The focus is on assessing Cross-Entropy loss, accuracy, and Complexity-Weighted Accuracy across training and validation datasets.
Significance: These foundational experiments establish baseline performance and highlight areas needing improvement, such as class imbalance and overfitting. These findings are crucial for refining model architectures and training strategies in subsequent stages.
Description: Each node involves constructing a graph-based representation of SPR sequences with nodes as token-strings encoded by shape and color. A two-layer GCN with global-mean pooling processes these graphs. Performance is tracked using Cross-Entropy loss, accuracy, and Complexity-Weighted Accuracy, with computations optimized for GPU use.

List_of_included_plots.description: The plot shows the cross-entropy loss for both training and validation over epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: Indicates potential overfitting as training loss decreases but validation loss plateaus and increases slightly.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot shows the cross-entropy loss for the training and validation datasets across epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: Both training and validation loss decrease, suggesting some generalization but with room for improvement.

List_of_included_plots.description: The plot shows the cross-entropy loss for both training and validation sets over epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: Validation loss stabilizes, indicating reasonable generalization and reduced overfitting compared to other nodes.

List_of_included_plots.description: The confusion matrix indicates an imbalanced classification performance.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: Highlights a bias towards a single class, suggesting a need for addressing class imbalance.

Key_numerical_results.analysis: Indicates good fit on training data but not reflected in validation performance, suggesting overfitting.
